title: TDSTF: Transformer-based Diffusion probabilistic model for Sparse Time series Forecasting. (arXiv:2301.06625v3 [cs.LG] UPDATED)
abstract: Background and objective: In the intensive care unit (ICU), vital sign monitoring is critical, and an accurate predictive system is required. This study will create a novel model to forecast Heart Rate (HR), Systolic Blood Pressure (SBP), and Diastolic Blood Pressure (DBP) in ICU. These vital signs are crucial for prompt interventions for patients. We extracted $24,886$ ICU stays from the MIMIC-III database, which contains data from over $46$ thousand patients, to train and test the model. Methods: The model proposed in this study, areansformerin intensive careabilistic Model for Sparse Time Series Forecasting (TDSTF), uses a deep learning technique called the Transformer. The TDSTF model showed state-of-the-art performance in predicting vital signs in the ICU, outperforming other models' ability to predict distributions of vital signs and being more computationally efficient. The code is available at https://github.com/PingChang818/TDSTF. Results: The results of the study showed that

tldr: 本文提出一种基于Transformer扩散概率模型的TDSTF模型，用于稀疏时间序列预测。该模型在预测ICU中的生命体征方面表现出了最先进的性能，能够更好地预测生命体征分布并且计算效率更高。
